description.narrative: Establishment of an integrated and innovative health management information system for improved decision making for child survival, and ECD, with improved data quality in line with national and international priorities and standards.

sector.narrative: ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services

title.narrative: China United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
China 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
China 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Establishment of an integrated and innovative health management information system for improved decision making for child survival, and ECD, with improved data quality in line with national and international priorities and standards.

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, the Healthy Family App (HFA) was expanded to an additional three provinces, enhancing interconnectivity and evidence-based decision-making for pregnant women, caregivers, health providers and programme managers. In the first half of 2020, due to COVID-19 outbreak in China, activities related to HFA have been delayed. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/07/2020

title.narrative: E-birth certificate with unique ID adopted and MCH service utilized in demonstration sites

target.value: 2020:Standards and Management Guidelines on E-birth certification developed to support national scaling up

actual.value: 2019:The Health Family App (HFA) with unique ID has been launched in six provinces. There were 316,601 users reached by HFA across the pilot areas.
